intro: Lithocarpus petelotii, commonly known as the Philippine stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts. It is a broadleaf evergreen tree native to the Philippines, typically found in lowland and montane forests. The plant is characterized by its hard, woody fruit, which contains a single seed surrounded by a thick, leathery husk. Its leaves are usually glossy and elliptical, with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. Lithocarpus petelotii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
